The National Labor Relations Board and the Secretary of Labor must review and revise regulations to implement the amendments made in this Act to the National Labor Relations Act and the Labor-Management Reporting and Disclosure Act of 1959. SEC. 5. LIMITATION ON SUPERVISION. SEC. 5. LIMITATION ON SUPERVISION. A court order requiring a third party to monitor a labor organization's actions and expenditures, with the organization covering monitoring expenses, expires 10 years after issuance. Subsection (a) applies to orders issued after the Act's enactment date. SEC. 6. CONSPIRACY TO RESTRAIN WORKERS' ABILITY TO SELECT REPRESENTATIVE. Amendment to the Clayton Act prohibits labor organizations from entering agreements that limit an employee's choice of collective representative.
